lab_guide:
## Example Lab

This is an example lab guide. Please feel free to clean it and ceate your own content.

Writing a lab guide in `Buzz vLabs` is fast and easy! You can quickly use Markdown to present rich contents in your lab guide.

In case you are not farmiliar with Markdown, please read through this guide, or check out the [GitHub Markdown cheatsheet](https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet) for a deepdive.

#### Lab task 1: - Basics

Let's explore how to use Markdown to write a simple guide here.

You can highline keyword `keyword`, make it bold **keyword**, or make it italic *keyword*.

You can include images in your lab guide like this:

![Buzz vLabs](http://127.0.0.1:8000/static/img/buzzlabs-sm.png)

This is a good quote:

> Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better.
> `Albert Einstein`


If you want to present some code, you can do it like this

    ls -l /

#### Lab task 2: Playing with tokens    
    
You can define mulitple lab environments in a lab, if you want to run the code in a one of the lab environment, you can put token `{cvlabs{env.your_env_slug}}` at the **first line** in your code block, the token will be picked up by Buzz vLabs during runtime. Following is an example:

    {cvlabs{env.linux}}
    ls -l /    
    
If you want to reference the ip address of a lab environment, you can use token `{cvlabs{env.your_env_slug.ip}}` in your text or a code block.

    connection = pika.BlockingConnection(pika.ConnectionParameters('{cvlabs{env.linux.ip}}'))
    channel = connection.channel()
    
To refernece a public serivce endpoind of your lab environment, please use following token. The token will be translated to a public domain name.

    {cvlabs{env.linux.service}}

#### Finish

Keep up the good work and create some great labs for learners!

environments.deployment:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
  name: example
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
  strategy: {}
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
    spec:
      containers:
      - command:
        - bash
        - -c
        - "echo PS1=lab#  >> /root/.bashrc;sleep 1d"
        image: centos
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 500m
            memory: 512Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 512Mi
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
        name: centos
status: {}
